titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: My wife went off to Corfe Castle on a visit to Grace Bankes. Before leaving we went together into the Chapel, and I â€˜churched' her. At noon I celebrated a marriage in S. Margaret's, and during the afternoon, Harold and I walked into the city, and visited S. Bartholomew's, Smithfield.

p.hi: Then I dined with Sidney Lee at 108
Lexham Gardens, W. Kensington. It was a pleasant party of historians.
Especially I had some conversation with Hunt, the co-editor with Stephens of the History of the Church of England.
